10:20.concept: Cleave to those who know G-d (and His Law)
Swear in G-d's Name to confirm the truth when deemed necessary by court

12:4.concept: Do not destroy objects associated with G-d's Name

18:15.concept: Listen to the prophet speaking in G-d's Name

13:17.concept: Burn a city that has turned to idol worship
Do not rebuild an idolatrous city that has been burned

13:18.concept: Do not derive benefit from an idolatrous city

13:12.concept: Do not entice an individual to idol worship

13:9.concept: Do not love those who entice others into idolatry
Do not cease hating an idolater
Do not save an idolater from execution
Do not say anything in an idolater's defense
Do not refrain from incriminating an idolater

18:20.concept: Do not prophesy in the name of idolatry
Do not prophesy falsely in the name of G-d

13:4.concept: Do not listen to a false prophet

18:22.concept: Do not be afraid of killing the false prophet

16:22.concept: Do not erect a pillar in a public place of worship

16:21.concept: Do not plant a tree in the Temple courtyard

7:26.concept: Do not derive benefit from idols and their accessories

7:25.concept: Do not derive benefit from ornaments of idols

7:2.concept: Do not make a covenant with idolaters
Do not show favor to idolaters

18:11.concept: Do not attempt to contact the dead
Do not consult ghosts or spirits
Do not consult magicians or wizards

18:10.concept: Do not perform acts of magic

22:5.concept: Men must not wear women's clothing
Women must not wear men's clothing

14:1.concept: Do not tear or cut the skin in mourning
Do not make a bald spot in mourning

6:9.concept: Put the commandments on each door post

31:19.concept: Each male must write a scroll of the Law

17:18.concept: The king must have a separate book of the Law for himself

16:3.concept: Do not eat leavened food on the afternoon of the 14th day of Nisan

22:13.concept: Marry a wife by means of a marriage agreement and sanctification

23:18.concept: Do not have sexual relations with women not married by means of a marriage agreement and sanctification
Do not offer animals bought with the wages of a harlot or the wages of a dog

24:1.concept: Issue a divorce by means of a get document

24:4.concept: A man must not remarry his ex-wife after she has married someone else

25:5.concept: A man must marry the widow of his childless brother
A childless widow must not remarry until the ties with her brother-in-law are removed

25:9.concept: A man must free the widow of his childless brother from the obligation to marry him if he is unwilling to marry her

22:29.concept: One who seduces a maiden must marry the maiden if she chooses
22:29.category: ἀνθ᾿ ὧν ἐταπείνωσεν αὐτήν· οὐ δυνήσεται ἐξαποστεῖλαι αὐτὴν τὸν ἅπαντα χρόνον.

22:29.concept: A seducer that marries the maiden he seduces must not divorce her

22:19.concept: A man who slanders his wife with accusations of adultery must remain married to his wife
22:19.category: οὐ δυνήσεται ἐξαποστεῖλαι αὐτὴν τὸν ἅπαντα χρόνον.

22:19.concept: A man who slanders his wife with accusations of adultery must not divorce her

7:3.concept: Do not marry those who are not members of the Covenant

23:4.concept: Do not let Moabite and Ammonite males marry into the Covenant people
23:4.category: (23:5) παρὰ τὸ μὴ συναντῆσαι αὐτοὺς ὑμῖν μετὰ ἄρτων καὶ ὕδατος ἐν τῇ ὁδῷ ἐκπορευομένων ὑμῶν ἐξ Αἰγύπτου

23:7.concept: Do not prevent a third-generation Egyptian convert from marrying into the Covenant people
Do not refrain from marrying a third generation Edomite convert
Do not offer peace to Ammon and Moab while besieging them

23:3.concept: Do not let a child born due to an illegal relationship marry into the Covenant people

23:1.concept: Do not let a eunuch marry into the Covenant people

14:11.concept: Examine the signs of fowl to distinguish between those which are kosher and non-kosher

14:19.concept: Do not eat non-kosher flying insects

14:21.concept: Do not eat of an animal that dies of natural causes

12:23.concept: Do not eat meat torn off a living creature

22:9.concept: Do not eat diverse seeds planted in a vineyard
Do not plant grains or greens in a vineyard

32:38.concept: Do not drink wine poured in service to idols

12:21.concept: Ritually slaughter an animal before eating it

22:6.concept: Do not take a mother bird with its children

22:7.concept: Release a mother bird before taking her children from the nest

23:23.concept: Fulfill what you uttered and do what you vowed

22:10.concept: Do not work different animals together

22:11.concept: Do not wear cloth woven of wool and linen

24:19.concept: Leave the forgotten sheaves in the field for the poor
Do not retrieve sheaves forgotten in the field but leave them for the poor

14:28.concept: Separate the tithe for the poor

15:8.concept: Give charity to those in need

15:7.concept: Do not withhold charity from the poor

18:4.concept: Set aside a gift of food for the priest
Give the first shearing of sheep to a priest

26:14.concept: Do not eat the second tithe while impure
A mourner on the first day after a death must not eat the second tithe

12:17.concept: Do not eat second tithe grains outside Jerusalem
Do not eat second tithe wine products outside Jerusalem
Do not eat second tithe oil outside Jerusalem
The priests must not eat the first fruits outside Jerusalem
Do not eat the meat of an offering away from the Temple
The priests must not eat the meat outside the Temple courtyard
The priests must not eat unblemished firstborn animals outside Jerusalem

26:13.concept: Read the confession of tithes every fourth and seventh year

26:5.concept: Read the portion of Scripture pertaining to the presentation of first fruits

15:2.concept: Release all loans during the seventh year
Do not pressure or claim from the borrower during the seventh year

15:9.concept: Do not refrain from lending immediately before the release of the loans for fear of monetary loss

18:1.concept: The Tribe of Levi must not be given a portion of the land in Israel
The Levites must not take a share in the spoils of war

18:6.concept: The work of the priests' shifts must be equal during holidays

23:11.concept: An impure person must not enter the Temple Mount area

17:1.concept: Do not offer a temporarily blemished animal

12:15.concept: To redeem dedicated animals which have become disqualified
Do not eat the meat of minor sacrifices before sprinkling the blood

12:5.concept: Bring all avowed and freewill offerings to the Temple on the first subsequent festival

23:22.concept: Do not withhold payment incurred by any vow

12:11.concept: Offer all sacrifices in the Temple

12:26.concept: Bring all sacrifices from outside Israel to the Temple

12:13.concept: Do not offer any sacrifices outside the courtyard

14:3.concept: Do not eat sacrifices which have become unfit or blemished

15:19.concept: Do not shear the fleece of consecrated animals

16:4.concept: Do not leave the meat of the Passover lamb of the 14th until the 16th

31:10.concept: Assemble all the people on the Feast of Tabernacles following the seventh year

24:8.concept: The unclean person must not remove his signs of impurity

25:13.concept: Do not possess inaccurate scales and weights even if they are not for use

19:14.concept: Do not move a boundary marker to steal someone's property

22:3.concept: Do not ignore a lost object

25:12.concept: Save someone from being killed by a blood avenger even by taking the life of the pursuer

19:3.concept: Designate cities of refuge and prepare routes of access

21:4.concept: Break the neck of a calf by the river valley following an unsolved murder
21:4.category: 4 καὶ καταβιβάσουσιν ἡ γερουσία τῆς πόλεως ἐκείνης τὴν δάμαλιν εἰς φάραγγα τραχεῖαν

21:4.concept: Do not work nor plant the river valley where an unsolved murder occurred

22:8.concept: Do not allow pitfalls and obstacles to remain on your property
Make a guard rail around flat roofs

22:4.concept: Do not leave others distraught with their burdens (but to help either load or unload)

15:14.concept: Give a Hebrew slave gifts when he goes free

15:13.concept: Do not send a Hebrew slave away empty-handed

23:16.concept: Do not extradite a slave who fled to the Land of Israel
Do not wrong a slave who has come to the Land of Israel for refuge

24:15.concept: Pay wages on the day they were earned

23:25.concept: The hired worker may eat from the unharvested crops where he works
The worker must not eat while on hired time
The worker must not take more than he can eat

25:4.concept: Do not muzzle an ox while plowing

15:3.concept: Press the idolater for payment of a loan

24:10.concept: The creditor must not forcibly take collateral

24:13.concept: Return the collateral to the debtor when needed

24:12.concept: Do not delay return of collateral when needed

24:17.concept: Do not demand collateral from a widow
A judge must not pervert a case involving a foreigner or orphan

24:6.concept: Do not demand as collateral utensils needed for preparing food

23:20.concept: Lend to and borrow from idolaters with interest

1:17.concept: Do not appoint judges who are not familiar with the Law
The judge must not fear a violent man in judgment

22:24.concept: The courts must carry out the death penalty of stoning
22:24.category: ἐξάξετε ἀμφοτέρους ἐπὶ τὴν πύλην τῆς πόλεως αὐτῶν

21:22.concept: The courts must hang those stoned for blasphemy or idolatry

21:23.concept: Bury the executed on the day they are killed

25:3.concept: The court must give lashes to the wrongdoer
The court must not exceed the prescribed number of lashes

22:26.concept: The court must not punish anybody who was forced to do a crime

19:13.concept: A judge must not pity the murderer or assaulter at the trial

19:15.concept: Do not accept testimony from a lone witness

24:16.concept: Relatives of the litigants must not testify

19:19.concept: Punish the false witnesses as they tried to punish the defendant

17:11.concept: Act according to the ruling of the Sanhedrin
Do not deviate from the word of the Sanhedrin

12:32.concept: Do not add any commandments to the Law
Do not diminish any commandments from the Law

21:18.concept: Do not be a rebellious son

17:15.concept: Do not appoint a foreigner as king

17:17.concept: The king must not have too many wives
The king must not have too much silver and gold

17:16.concept: The king must not have too many horses
Do not dwell permanently in Egypt

20:16.concept: Do not let any of the seven Canaanite nations remain alive

25:19.concept: Wipe out the descendants of Amalek
Do not forget Amalek's atrocities and ambush on our journey from Egypt in the desert

25:17.concept: Remember what Amalek did to the Israelites

20:19.concept: Do not destroy fruit trees even during the siege

23:13.category: (23:14) καὶ πάσσαλος ἔσται σοι ἐπὶ τῆς ζώνης σου

23:14.concept: Prepare a shovel for each soldier to dig with

20:2.concept: Appoint a priest to speak with the soldiers during the war

24:5.concept: Do not demand any communal or military involvement for one year

20:3.concept: Do not panic and retreat during battle

21:11.concept: Keep the laws of the captive woman
21:11.category: 11 καὶ ἴδῃς ἐν τῇ προνομῇ γυναῖκα καλὴν τῷ εἴδει καὶ ἐνθυμηθῇς αὐτῆς καὶ λάβῃς αὐτὴν σαυτῷ γυναῖκα

21:14.concept: Do not sell a captive woman into slavery
Do not retain a captive woman for servitude after having sexual relations with her
